result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis C Cuccia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Def not to be at or around BP Stop & Go at 3734 Speedway Rd Madison, WI.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Stayed for use by agent upon requesting to the Court.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERED TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $2,000 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case.
